content.question: The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 4 plus 1 fourth square root of 144 minus 9 open parentheses x plus 3 close parentheses squared end root"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msqrt><mn>144</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></math>. In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is half of the graph of which of the following implicitly defined functions?

choices.label: <math alttext="y minus 4 equals 1 fourth open parentheses 12 minus 3 open parentheses x plus 3 close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><mn>12</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses x plus 3 close parentheses squared over 4 squared plus open parentheses y minus 4 close parentheses squared over 3 squared equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mn>4</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses x plus 3 close parentheses squared over 4 squared plus open parentheses y minus 4 close parentheses squared over 6 squared equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mn>4</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mn>6</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses x plus 3 close parentheses squared over 4 squared plus open parentheses y minus 4 close parentheses squared over 48 squared equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mn>4</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mn>48</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parentheses x plus 3 close parentheses squared over 4 squared plus open parentheses y minus 4 close parentheses squared over 3 squared equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mn>4</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
